PixelToaster::TrueColorPixel

TrueColorPixel Union Reference

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Represents a pixel in truecolor mode.

Each pixel consists of three 8 bit color values packed into a 32 bit integer.

The color components are stored in the integer in rgb order. The high 8 bits are referred to as 'alpha' but are not used.

Here are some examples:

  • black = 0x00000000
  • white = 0x00FFFFFF
  • grey = 0x007F7F7F
  • red = 0x00FF0000
  • purple = 0x00FF00FF
  • green = 0x0000FF00

Obviously it can get quite tedious manipulating the integer directly, so this union gives you the option of directly accessing the integer, or manipulating each of the 8 bit component values directly:

TrueColorPixel pixel;
pixel.r = 0;
pixel.g = 255;
pixel.b = 0;

And voila, you have a green pixel. Beware though that unlike floating point color, truecolor does not clamp the components for you. You need to ensure that your values stay within the [0,255] range or they will wrap around and the pixel color will not be what you intended.

Note:
The top 8 bits of the integer are unused and are referred to as 'alpha'. You can use these bits for 8 bits of per-pixel storage, or ignore them completely, they have absolutely no effect on the pixel color.


Public Member Functions

 TrueColorPixel ()
 The default constructor sets the pixel to black.
